name: The Mathematical Universe
description: A world where number sets nest inside each other, constants dwell in their smallest home, and functions roam the real line.

manifest.author: mrklas
manifest.lore: Before things had names, there were numbers. The Mathematical Universe is the totality of all that can be precisely described — constants drifting through nested sets, functions mapping the infinite, primes standing indivisible at the foundations of arithmetic. Here, entropy runs backwards: the closer a thing is to its true place, the more whole it becomes.

entities.name: Mathematical Universe
entities.description: The totality of all mathematical objects. Infinite in every direction.

entities.name: Complex Numbers (C)
entities.description: Numbers of the form a + bi. Contains all number sets below.

entities.name: Real Numbers (R)
entities.description: The continuous number line. Home of pi, e, and most famous constants.

entities.name: Rational Numbers (Q)
entities.description: All fractions p/q. Dense on the real line, yet full of gaps.

entities.name: Integers (Z)
entities.description: Whole numbers, positive and negative. The backbone of arithmetic.

entities.name: Natural Numbers (N)
entities.description: 0, 1, 2, 3 ... The counting numbers. Where mathematics begins.

entities.name: Square Root
entities.description: Maps non-negative reals to non-negative reals. Squeamish about negatives. Happy in the complex plane.

entities.name: Exponential (e^x)
entities.description: Always positive, always growing. The most natural of all functions.

entities.name: Sine
entities.description: Periodic, bounded, smooth. The universe's favorite oscillator.

entities.name: Zero (0)
entities.description: The additive identity. Represents nothing, yet everything depends on it.

entities.name: One (1)
entities.description: The multiplicative identity. The beginning of counting.

entities.name: Pi (3.14159...)
entities.description: The ratio of a circle's circumference to its diameter. Never repeats, never ends, never apologizes.

entities.name: Euler's Number (2.71828...)
entities.description: The base of natural logarithm. Grows the way growth itself grows.

entities.name: Golden Ratio (1.61803...)
entities.description: Appears in sunflowers, spirals, and art. The most aesthetically pleasing irrational.

entities.name: Imaginary Unit (i)
entities.description: Square root of -1. Exists beyond the real line. Politely ignored for centuries, now indispensable.

entities.name: Prime Numbers
entities.description: The atoms of arithmetic. Infinitely many, irregularly spaced, stubbornly irreducible.

entities.name: Irrational
entities.description: Cannot be expressed as a ratio of integers. Infinite, non-repeating — fills the gaps between rationals.

entities.name: Operation
entities.description: A mapping that transforms mathematical objects according to defined rules.

entities.name: Transcendental
entities.description: Not the root of any polynomial with rational coefficients. Escapes algebraic capture.

entities.name: Algebraic
entities.description: A root of a polynomial equation with rational coefficients. Lives between integers and transcendentals.
